title: Morristown National Historical Park: Places
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Places               Places          Morristown National Historical Park is comprised of four discontiguous areas with the Museum, Ford Mansion and Fort Nonsense in the northern part of the park and Jockey Hollow and the NJ brigade in the southern area. To learn more about the different areas of the park click on site name Ford Mansion - Washington's Headquarters Jockey Hollow Fort Nonsense The New Jersey Brigade and Cross Estate Gardens  Â    Local Partners & Additional Information Resources  Morris County Visitors Center  New Jersey Skylands  Visit New Jersey  Crossroads of the American Revolution  Cross Estate Gardens
